description_txt: stated on June 4, 2008 in St. Petersburg, Fla.:
quote_txt: When the United States invaded Iraq, Saddam Hussein wanted to acquire weapons of mass destruction, and "he said so himself after his capture."

description_txt: stated on May 28, 2008 in an e-mail.:
quote_txt: "Fidel Castro endorses Obama."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2008 in an interview on Fox News' America's Election HQ:
quote_txt: "Ronald Reagan met with Gorbachev; Kennedy met with Khruschev; and Nixon met with Mao — and these were folks who have done horrendous damage not only to their own countries but to other countries."

description_txt: stated on June 3, 2008 in a campaign e-mail:
quote_txt: "Obama voted to support President Bush between 40 and 50 percent of the time over the past two years."

description_txt: stated on June 3, 2008 in St. Paul, Minn.:
quote_txt: "John McCain decided to stand with George Bush 95 percent of the time (last year)."

description_txt: stated on June 1, 2008 in San Juan, Puerto Rico:
quote_txt: "We are winning the popular vote."

description_txt: stated on May 27, 2008 in a statement by campaign spokesman Bill Burton:
quote_txt: John McCain "has not led on nonproliferation issues when he had the chance in the Senate."

description_txt: stated on May 29, 2008 in Greensdale, Wis.:
quote_txt: "We have drawn down to presurge levels. Basra, Mosul and now Sadr City are quiet and it's long and it's tough and there will be setbacks."

description_txt: stated on May 22, 2008 in Tampa, Fla.:
quote_txt: "I think we came down here (to Florida) one time ... but we weren't actively fundraising here."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2008 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Obama's wife wrote a paper in college that said America was a nation founded on "crime and hatred" and that whites in America are "ineradicably racist."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2008 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Obama's wife said her goal in life was to put the black community "first and foremost."

description_txt: stated on May 28, 2008 in a town hall meeting in Reno, Nev.:
quote_txt: "Sen. Obama has been to Iraq once."

description_txt: stated on May 26, 2008 in a speech in Las Cruces, N.M.:
quote_txt: "I had an uncle ... who was part of the first American troops to go into Auschwitz and liberate the concentration camps."

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2008 in Sioux Falls, S.D.:
quote_txt: It doesn't make sense "historically" to drop out because the 1968 race was still competitive when "Bobby Kennedy was assassinated in June in California."

description_txt: stated on May 21, 2008 in Tampa, Fla.:
quote_txt: McCain "hired some of the biggest lobbyists in Washington to run his campaign."

description_txt: stated on May 21, 2008 in a speech in Tampa, Fla.:
quote_txt: When McCain was questioned about hiring lobbyists to his campaign staff, "his top lobbyist actually had the nerve to say, 'The American people won't care about this.' "

description_txt: stated on May 21, 2008 in Tampa, Fla.:
quote_txt: "Ten years ago, John McCain offered a bill that said he would ban a candidate from paying registered lobbyists."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2008 in a speech in Gresham, Ore.:
quote_txt: "Privatizing Social Security was a bad idea when George W. Bush proposed it. It's a bad idea today. Sen. McCain's campaign went even further ... suggesting ... to cut cost-of-living adjustments or to raise the retirement age."

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2008 in an e-mail:
quote_txt: John McCain, "one of the richest people in a Senate filled with millionaires," says the solution to the housing crisis is for people to get a "second job" and "skip their vacations."

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2008 in Chicago:
quote_txt: "Sen. Obama has declared, and repeatedly reaffirmed his intention to meet the president of Iran without any preconditions."

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2008 in Chicago:
quote_txt: Iran "might not be a superpower, but the threat the government of Iran poses is anything but 'tiny,'" as Obama says.

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2008 in a Q&A in Cape Girardeau, Mo.:
quote_txt: A gas tax holiday is a gimmick that "every economist says will just go into the pockets of the oil companies."

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2008 in Charleston, W.V.:
quote_txt: John McCain "is one of the few senators of either party who oppose this bill (to expand education aid for veterans) because he thinks it's too generous."

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2008 in an e-mail:
quote_txt: McCain "voted against a bill to ban waterboarding, and then applauded President Bush for vetoing that ban."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2008 in Cape Girardeau, Miss.:
quote_txt: "NATO hasn't provided enough troops (in Afghanistan) because they are still angry about us going into Iraq."

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2008 in a statement by a spokesman:
quote_txt: "Obama himself voted against funding our nation's veterans and troops in the field during a time of war."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2008 in a speech in Charleston, W.Va.:
quote_txt: "The White House is won in the swing states, and I am winning the swing states."

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2008 in an e-mail message:
quote_txt: McCain sought the political support of minister John Hagee, "who believes Hurricane Katrina was God's punishment for gay rights and called the Catholic Church 'the Antichrist' and a 'false cult.'"

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2008 in an e-mail message:
quote_txt: "The pastor McCain calls his 'spiritual guide,' Rod Parsley, believes America's founding mission is to destroy Islam, which he calls a 'false religion.' "

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2008 in Logan, W. Va.:
quote_txt: "If West Virginia had voted for our Democratic nominee in 2000 and 2004, we wouldn't have had to put up with George Bush for the last 7 years."
